headline: Why Monster (MNST) Stock Is Nosediving
summary: Shares of energy drink company Monster Beverage (NASDAQ:MNST) fell 5.2% in the pre-market session after the company reported disappointing first quarter 2025 results: while gross margin beat expectations, revenue missed significantly. Revenue dropped over 2%, weighed down by fewer orders from distributors, currency hits overseas, and a sharp fall in alcohol-related sales. Management did point to stronger sales in April and solid retail numbers for energy drinks overall, which could mean things a

headline: Monster Beverage Q1 Earnings Beat, Lower Sales Across Segments Hurt
summary: MNST posts earnings beat in first-quarter 2025 results. Its Monster Energy Drinks segment's sales fell 0.6% year over year.

headline: Monster Beverage (NasdaqGS:MNST) Reports Flat Sales But Slight EPS Growth
summary: Monster Beverage (NasdaqGS:MNST) saw its share price rise by 29% over the last quarter amid stable earnings despite a slight sales decline in Q1 2025. The increase in both basic and diluted EPS to USD 0.45 from USD 0.42 in the previous year could have positively influenced investor sentiment. Concurrently, the broader market exhibited a modest climb, driven by optimism around U.S.-China tariff talks and ongoing Federal Reserve interest rate decisions. Alongside these factors, executive...
